Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: J. Graves "video game dad"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for over a week now.  This is my second HDTV LCD panel but my first in a larger size.This unit packs a lot into a nice package for a really nice price.  If you're looking for something just one notch below premium (i.e. a great set with great value) then buy this set.  Don't be thrown by the price; this TV looks great and performs superbly.720p at this screen size is perfect.  1080p below 42 inches is wasteful feature bloat that you don't need to pay for.  High Def channels look phenomenal on this set.  XBOX360 over component is terrific.  My HD feed is fiber optic.  I have not tested over-the-air reception of this unit yet.Standard Def (regular TV) is very good compared to what I've seen on other sets in stores and at friends' houses.  The internal signal up-converter is solid.  DVD over component hookups looks very nice.Display adjustment options are extensive.  Some tweaking is needed out-of-the-box but this is very easy to do, and you can look online (AVSForum is great) for help in this arena.ClearVoice sound (emphasizes dialogue over sound effects & music) is a great option and works well.The internal speakers are surprisingly decent if that's all you have.  They have very little bass, but the mid-range sound is fairly full.  We have a small 2.1 speaker system that we will use, but I haven't yet felt compelled to hook it up while we get the sighting and wiring runs finalized.The biggest problem I had with TV was getting the stand attached.  Once I got that sorted out, the rest of setup was a breeze.I paid more money than this set is listed for here, and I'm still thrilled with my purchase.  That should say a lot.

Reviews.Title: The best so far
Reviews.Author: Gilbert V. Lepadatu
Reviews.Content: I bought this one a couple of days ago for $600+taxes. For some reason, both I and my wife thought there was something wrong with it, very good image quality but somewhat dim for our tastes - in all fairness, we still watch many channels in standard or digital definition.So, we bought a better one, a Samsung 37'', 1080p, NC550... According to all reviews, it was supposed to be better, a lot better, it was a 1080p for God's sake!. And, as we soon found out, this one was not "dim" by any measures!I have calibrated the LG (do a search on google), and tried to do the same thing with the Samsung but I could not find any websites with the needed calibration information. I tweaked the settings on Samsung for hours on end. After 6-8 hours of watching both TVs, side by side, on a variety of channels (HD, Digital and Analog - I have not tried to hook them up to my laptop, though nor played any games on them!!!), the decision was somewhat easy. Incredibly, unexpectedly, the LG (37'', 760p) was significantly much better than the Samsung (37'', 1080p etc.). The image was much clearer and warmer, more pleasant to the eyes, the faces on both SD and Digital signals much clearer, more... "acceptable". On an HD signal alone, we could not see any significant difference at all (again, we both liked the LG but it was just an a preference by now!). We watched both of them, the same channel, the same cable signal, at the same time ... I know it sounds incredible, but we both liked the LG more.The price was not an issue, the Samsung was just a $100 more (at Brandsmart USA). I was totally surprised: I thought the Samsung would blow us away (it was SAMSUNG, 1080p!!!. 5th generation after all), but it so turned out that the image on the LG was way much better. My wife kept telling me: I like the LG more, but if you think Samsung is better, then it is up to you! It took me hours to finally give up a "better" TV, the Samsung (1080p), for the LG (720p), but I did it. Now, when we watch TV (LG), we love it!I have my doubts, but I am open to the remote possibility that some "calibration settings" on the Samsung could offer an image equal or even better in quality than the one on LG. I would be very, very, very surprised though...We've also had a Plasma, 42''. Hitachi, TV in our Living room for 2 years now. Excellent TV, on all signals... The LG is not "better" is a bit different...I suggest that you buy two of the Tvs you like, bring them home, set them up in the room you like, watch them side by side, and THEN decide. Otherwise, you don't know how good (or bad) your TV is! What you watch in the showroom and EVEN THE TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS are only an INDICATION of what your TV would look like to your own eyes in your own room.All the best!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: K.Su "Dr. Sylar"
Reviews.Content: Having the 37LG30 for 2 weeks now, I think it is one of the best HDTV in its class. I trust the brand name because LG is the one that provides LCD panels to those graphic professionals.  I love the overall quality. And it looks pretty nice fit to my small living room.  What is my take? Be sure to run color calibration to suit your own eyes. Enjoy your TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Selectronic Media Group
Reviews.Content: HD Looks AmazingSD Looks GreatThe Tv Has Expert Calibration Settings so you can get the best pictureSound is ok, But I use a home theatre system for that.3 HDMI 1.3a inputs2 Component2 Standard A/V1 S-Video1 Cpu Input1 Optical Audio Out1 Stereo Audio outEasy to use menu interfaceNice remote controlI highly recommend this for anyone looking for a first Hdtv, this one works great in my bedroom

Reviews.Title: Great LCD tv at a great price
Reviews.Author: Pathguy
Reviews.Content: This is my second LCD tv, the first being a 32" Samsung which was my main living room tv.  I wanted a larger unit so I went with a 37-incher and must say that the 37LG30 has been superb so far.  The unit is sleak and stylish, and was easy to install.  I have standard cable and an upconverting DVD player connected with an HDMI cable.  Cable shows look good, but the real beauty of this tv is revealed with movies in 720p.  The picture is amazing!  Sound is ok, but I use a speaker bar/subwoofer unit for everything and it really upgrades the sound.  I did not compare this unit with the Samsung LN37A450 (or with my own Samsung LCD for that matter) but I'm sure you can't go wrong with either model.  The LG was $150 cheaper at the time of purchase, so price was somewhat of an influence.  If you're going to buy an LCD tv and have room for a 37-inch, I definitely recommend it over a 32-inch.  The bigger screen size is worth it!

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!!
Reviews.Author: Evelyn Lynn
Reviews.Content: I'm no expert, but I really enjoy watching this TV.  Sometimes I find myself just looking at how great the picture is instead of watching the show itself!  Lots of customization, great sound (some of the best I've heard on a TV), and easy to operate.  This thing looks awesome in my living room too, just sitting there.  This LG is perfect if you don't feel the need to waste extra money on a TV that has a high-end brand name (Sony, Panasonic, etc.) and you just want a nice TV.  My boyfriend kept telling me I should spend an extra $200 and get one of those high-end TV's but I'm really glad I didn't.  I like mine much better than his Panasonic.  The 37" is the perfect size for a room where you're about 8 feet away from the TV, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: Jeffry Schulz "JEFFRY"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love every aspect of it except one thing. The stand is a pain to install. Make sure that u have really good, thin handled phillips screwdriver handy otherwise you will have to do what i had to,  go out and buy one for the occasion.  I chose LG because the picture looked better on this tv than to other comparable make and models.  I was actually very shocked that it out performed  brands that cost almost twice as much.  Fast scenes showed up great (some HDTVs has some problems with blurring on fast paced scenes) the menu is so easy to use. It really is a very user friendly tv. If you were like me and have a hard time deciding between the 720p and the 1080p  HDTVs keep reading.Like most of you i went out and did my homework on buying my HDTV. At first i was hell bent on buying one that was 1080p and so i refused to look at any 720p tv. Then i went into a store and they had both the 720p and the 1080p lg tvs right next to each other. as i compared the 2 side by side i could not tell the difference between the 2. Like most of you who have been doing the same thing as me,  it really confused me.  I thought that the 1080p should have been alot better. So i went back home and researched more.  Then i found 2 articles on-line, one on c-net and the other consumer reports and both said that it is not the resolution (IE 720p 1080p) your looking for, it is more the contrast, brightness, and black levels you need to look at.  In other words, you pick out HDTV's exactly the same way you would if u were buying a standard tube since once u cross over to HD there is not a noticeable difference between the resolutions even with blu ray.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Gorgeous Picture!
Reviews.Author: Joe "Sidecreek"
Reviews.Content: I was torn between this TV and a Samsung LN32A450, although the Samsung was smaller that was not the reason I selected the LG. Both models were side by side in the store (yes, I bought at a store and not from Amazon - fear not, Amazon gets enough of my money!) and the pictures looked great on both, but, the LG seemed a little sharper and brighter in my opinion.I have this plugged up to my PS3 and the Blu-Ray movies look awesome! The games look great as well and no "blurring" that I can tell in fast moving scenes (this LG has a 5ms response time.)Although the TV is 720p output you could not tell the difference between 720p and 1080i/p on a set this size. Good rule of thumb: 40" lower 720p is fine, larger than 40" 1080p is needed.Compare the specs to other TV's for yourself but, a 12,000:1 contrast ratio and a 500 cd/m² for this price is a no-brainer! Basically, if you bought this TV you would not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Erin Bailey "Erin"
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the style and quality of this product. It is the perfect size for my one bedroom apartment! The picutre quality is wonderful thus far...I've only had it for a couple of weeks, but with HD cable, and even regular channels, the quality is still very good! Some channels the sound is very quiet, but others the standard volume is just fine! I'd definitely buy this product again, and for the price, it was a steal!

Reviews.Title: a solid choice but....
Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: I will say that I think this is a great TV for the price. It has a lot of nice options and the HD looks great. This LG would have gotten a solid 4 stars...The only drawback? The sound is terrible (- 1 star), The internal speakers don't cut it. The sound on a regular channel is okay but not great, once you get to an HD channel forget it, the sound bottoms right out.You can turn the volume to 100% and still miss dialogue even with the clear voice option on (and yes I've had my hearing checked, its fine.)Maybe I'm being picky but I have a Samsung 40" and the sound on that tv is great nothing more needed. I will need to get a surround sound system for the LG to be able to enjoy it more and hear it when I'm more than 3 feet away.Overall the money saved in getting this model balances things out. I'm not too upset over having to get a surround sound system for it.Bottom line this TV is a solid purchase, just be prepared to sink some more money into some better sound.

Reviews.Title: LG Customer Service is Old Fashioned and Top Notch!
Reviews.Author: Jake Hegnauer "CyberDyneSystems"
Reviews.Content: Like so many others, I was pleasantly surprised that while looking only at the best "name brand" 32 and 37 inch LCDs I happened across an LG and found it to compare very favorably.I had committed to buying only Samsung, Sony or Sharp... LG changed all that.Great features, competitive price, and seemingly superior image quality tempted me,. but it was the comments on line regarding customer service that sold me.Well, I love this TV, it's been a dream, however after 9 months I had reason to need LG's customer service.The TV has intermittently stopped responding to the remote controls.I found my manual and called LG, I was speaking to Scott in customer service after the shortest most sensible "phone menu" I have encountered.Scott was helpful and courteous.He scheduled a repair to come into my home the next day!Folks, this is important! You must consider this when buying!I can recommend this TV without reservation, but more so I can recommend LG as they will stand by the product and the customer if things go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Sometimes compromises are in your favor...
Reviews.Author: Reighmund
Reviews.Content: (FYI: This review is written after seven months of use of TV)In my studying of which LCD TV to buy for myself (including options of sizing, brand names, etc.), one of the things I kept running across on different websites and forums was (when talking size) "When Does 1080p Become Irrelevant?" Some said smaller than 42" - you can't tell the difference. Others said smaller than 40" - you can't tell the difference. Even though the inner me - the guy that desires the newest and bestest of what technology has to offer - wanted to choose a 1080p model... it didn't matter once I realized I was going with a 37" LCD TV. I knew it would behoove me (financially) to choose the 720p model. And I am glad I did!-Aesthetically pleasing design-Truly fantastic picture quality-Brand name: LG-Remote control is simple and easy to use-The menu options are clean and not complicatedIn closing, do yourself a favor: if you're gonna buy an LCD TV that's (only for the sake of using a number) 40" or smaller, set your pride aside and choose a 720p model. Supposedly you won't be able to tell the difference either way. AND YOU'LL BENEFIT FROM IT FINANCIALLY.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a Great Price!!
Reviews.Author: Reader
Reviews.Content: Great TV!!I read lots of reviews and poured over this decision for a long time, and finally decided on this one because user reviews were so high and the price was so low. I also chose this because the sound is supposed to be better than comparable LCDs (Samsung), and I don't currently have a surround sound set up.I watch a LOT of TV and movies--but I don't have a ton of money--and so I wanted a LCD HDTV that would be a joy and a pleasure, one that would be a sure upgrade from a 27" Sony tube TV I had been using for the past 4 years, but one that would not break my small bank.This TV seemed like the best for that set of criteria and it has definitely met my expectations. I love it. And I tell people that randomly in conversation.If you want a great TV at a truly decent price, this is that TV.

Reviews.Title: Seems to be nice TV
Reviews.Author: J. Regan
Reviews.Content: I haven't had alot of time to play with it.  I simply hooked it up to my satellite receiver and just began watching it.  The picture looks fine, so for now I've decided to not upgrade to HD from the satellite company.  I'm happy with what I have at this point.

Reviews.Title: Great quality for the price
Reviews.Author: R. Sanders
Reviews.Content: I mulled over the options for months for purchasing my first HDTV.  I decided I wanted a 37" 720p TV.  (32" seemed too small and 40" too large).  There's no reason to waste the money on 1080p for this size.  I wanted to purchase a well-respected brand and kept my eye on Samsung and Sony TVs for quite some time.  I actually ordered a Samsung A330, but then received an email from the supplier stating the TV was out of stock.  The other Samsung and Sony models were $800 or more, but I only wanted to spend $700 or less on a TV.  I started to consider looking into other brands, which I am glad I did.  After reading the reviews from several sites, I settled on purchasing this TV for $650.  With no tax or shipping costs, it was a better deal than anything you could find in a store.  The shipping was fast and the delivery man placed the TV in my living room for me.  Putting the TV together wasn't difficult.  I wasn't very happy with the picture at first, but spend a couple of minutes to calibrate the picture settings from recommendations online and it will do wonders!  I couldn't be happier with this TV and I can't believe I waited so long to buy one.  Now my boyfriend will actually come over to my house and not complain about watching movies on my TV (he has a 40" Sony 1080p).  His TV cost about $400 more, but I definitely wouldn't say that his TV looks that much greater than mine.  Yes, as others have mentioned, the volume does need to be turned up more than you would expect. You can't completely blare it, but who really needs that anyway.  Bottom line, if you want a reasonably sized TV that's a great quality for an awesome price, the 37" LG30 won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: Mostly Pleased
Reviews.Author: Corey J. Robinson "Researchoholic"
Reviews.Content: First off, let me tell you that I did weeks of research when I decided to purchase a new TV. My viewing distance is approximately 10 feet so I decided to get a 37 inch versus a 32 inch. Good choice although it took a few days for my brain to accomadate all that stimulation since I used to watch a 27 inch CRT. The inputs and outputs are more than adequate with 3 HDMI, 2 component ect...  The remote is fine aesthetically and it is simple. Assembly  of the base was super simple so I don't know how others that reviewed this TV interpreted the instructions. Now for the picture. Standard definition on this set looks fine. Some channels worse than others but overall tolerable and the difference eventually goes unnoticed. However, the High Definition looks spectacular as well as DVD's. Most of my TV watching is through a cable box with HD capabilities. The picture settings (color) can be easily adjusted with presets or you can get super-customized if you wish. You can really fine tune this thing. I have not used it as a computer monitor and likely never will. The sound is cool because the voice technology is very evident. There are no visible speakers because they are cut under and behind the set. The sound is stragely ambient and is slightly dull. I run my sound through a Bose 3-2-1 system so I do not need to tolerate any sound impurity. Lastly, for the price range you can't go wrong, with all the inputs, the customization options and the refresh rate is 5ms!!! There is a 5 second wait to power on once you press the power button. Oh yeah, one more thing, there is no noise what-so-ever when the TV is on except for the sounds you should hear. Love it so far.

Reviews.Title: Life IS Good for HD experience, watching and gaming.
Reviews.Author: 1Dub79
Reviews.Content: Initially, I bought a Vizio VS370E for $599.00, at Target. It was a nice HDTV. Plus, it was a limited edition. Still, I just could not help thinking about the negative overall ratings that the Vizios were getting. Everywhere I looked, I saw reviews and comments on the TV. The majority were negative. I was thinking that I would eventually have problems with the TV. Plus, I did not like the fact that when I played Madden 2009 for my PS3, the players were very blurry. Prior to the snap, you could just see how blurry the helmets were. It was just very noticable. I did not like it. Then, while passing, the players were totally blurry. This changes, once the camera comes a little closer. I hated that. I bought a Vizio HDMI cable and it cleared up a little, but not much. Overall, I figured that this was not a good gaming TV. That was a red flag, in itself.Prior to even getting this TV, I continuoulsy noticed how the LGs, Sonys, and Toshibas were getting good reviews and ratings. I decided to buy the LG because it was reliable and more affordable than a Sony. Plus, my Grandmother has one. I was impressed with it. I payed $598.88 for the HDTV, at BrandSmart. I have noticed that LG seems to make good products. I have an LG Voyager. It is a great touch screen cell phone. I also have an LG bluetooth.Anyway, this is a really good HDTV. The picture is very vivid and colorful, especially when watching on HD channels. You wouldn't know that the TV is a 720p. With a Philips HDMI cable SWV3534 6 ft High speed, it steps the picture up to a 1080p. My wife even noticed the difference. If you don't believe it, watch a program on a regular channel! Then, watch the same channel in HD. You will notice a biiiiiig difference. To see if this HDTV was good for gaming, I decided to test it with my PS3. Of course, tested it on Madden 2009. The players were not blurry in no other way ala Vizio. Then, I decided to buy a Monster HDMI cable and plugged it up to my PS3. Then, a message popped up, stating that it recognized the HDMI cable. Then, I was given a menu, which gave me a couple of options, which I said YES to. Then, the menu noted that the resolution would go to 1080p. I got excited. Then, I noticed that the letters on the menu went from big to small.I went on to re-play Madden and I noticed a biiiiig difference in the quality of the picture. After seeing the "it's in the game" screen, I saw that the following screen said EASports HD Gaming. Without the HDMI cable, it used to just say EASports. That was one indication that I was going to see some really enhanced HD graphics. Then, I played the game. All I could say was, wow! The graphics were more enhanced, detailed, colorful and crisp. Can you imagine anything better than PS3 graphics with 1080p resolution? You just cannot get any better than that. The only thing about the change in resolution is that the camera shows the players at a distance and does not zoom in on the players. This does not matter. The enhanced graphics will make you forget about that. If you are a gamer, I highly recommend that you get this TV, as well as the cable. Of course, other games show great, too. I played Killzone 2 and COD4, to name a few. Picture those games in 1080p!!! The DVDs or Blu-rays that you play will show great, as well. You WILL see a VERY noticable difference.The only things that I do not like on this TV is the sound system is not that great. The other issue is the stand is a little nerve racking to put on. Other than that, I am very satisfied with the product. Plus, I have comfort in knowing I have an HDTV with a good reputation. On the safe side, I still got a three year warranty because the regular warranty, which comes with the TV does not cover everything that the extended warranty covers. Additionally, before deciding to pay extra money on a 1080p HDTV, I would suggest saving your money and buying this HDTV, along with the cables. You will get the same results.

Reviews.Title: Great Service!
Reviews.Author: Jen K
Reviews.Content: I normally would not take the time to write a review, but there are two reasons that i am... 1. I found other's reviews helpful and 2. more importlantly i received EXCELLENT service. When I received my TV 2 days before xmas, the box had a good size gash in it. It wasn't until i went to set the TV up a few days after xmas, that i realized something had gone throught the box and scratched the screen. The small scratch on the screen radiated throughout the entire panel and basically the TV was trashed. I was so disappointed as this was my first purchase though AMAZON and to begin with I was skeptical about purchasing such a large item online (but the price could not be beat!!) Anyhow, I called the supplier and they were very helpful!! They immediately sent me a new TV and arranged to have the damaged one picked up! I was VERY satified with AMAZON!

Reviews.Title: QAM Tuner a big PLUS
Reviews.Author: R. Labonte "NASCAR man"
Reviews.Content: QAM tuner in a TV gets High Def even if you don't subscribe to it. I found that out because I don't have a COMCAST BOX (BUT I DO GET ALL THE DIGITAL SIGNALS) to the the LG HDTV. Since COMCAST broadcasts with ALL SIGNALS present on the CABLE to my house, then all one needs is the proper TUNER in the proper set, and you'll get HD. The LG has the correct tuner and the correct display parameters (pixels etc..) and I get HDTV displayed, for no additional cost. I use a separate cable-TV input for those channels, apart from my "normal" TIVO channels.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Jeffster
Reviews.Content: This TV replaces an older Toshiba 27' CRT, so a new, 37' HD LCD flat screen was going to be a big improvement no matter what.  That said, we couldn't be more pleased with the performance.  Fantastic picture, easy set-up, all for just under $700.I did a lot of research before buying and was convinced that, for the money, the LG30 was a great deal.  Since it was a 37', I was able to save a bit more going for the 720p instead of the 1080p which would not make a difference on this screen size.I hooked it up to an unconverting DVD player and our movies have never looked better.  Not quite Blu-Ray quality, but so close that it makes no sense to me to spend the extra $$$ and inconvenience of switching to Blu-Ray.  Besides, all my current DVDs are standard-def -- I'm not going to replace them with Blu-Ray.Only nit is that attaching the base stand to the TV was much more difficult than it should have been.  Of the four screws, I could only attach two.  The other two slots were not aligned quite correctly.  However, that is pretty minor.

Reviews.Title: LG HDTV
Reviews.Author: The Saint
Reviews.Content: Excellent product.  Very easy to set up.  Picture very good.  This is the 2nd LG HDTV we have purchased and are very pleased with the brand.

Reviews.Title: lg tv
Reviews.Author: Russell T. Dagilis "rtd"
Reviews.Content: I would recommend lg tvs ,the scarlet line is great, also we have installed only lg tv's at the hotel at which I work. No major problems to report on any of the 280  sets that were installed.

Reviews.Title: LG 37LG30 LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Roy in MN
Reviews.Content: Arrived in just two days in perfect conditdion via Fedex.  Setup was straight forward and it works very well.  The one area they could improve is the product manual.  It is just adequate.

Reviews.Title: happy so far
Reviews.Author: Faith Love
Reviews.Content: Chose this based on the 5 stars it gets here & Bestbuy/circuitcity.coms. Actually never looked at tvs in stores since its hard to get out, but the sales guy on phone at circuit city said this is rated 3rd by Consumer Reports. I needed this size to fit my ent.center so chose 720p based on other reports & its mostly fine. We use standard cable (not HD) yet and the regular channels are slightly fuzzy. We can live with it since we don't wish to invest more in our cable company. The tv automatically plays channels in the 100 range which are HD or maybe dig channels-I don't know, but they're VERY clear & enjoyable. Just like the nbc/cbs/abc channels after 5pm, they broadcast in hd and I guess the antenna picks it up. Wii looks great on this tv. Very easy to set up & lock out programs I don't want the kids to view. Also easy is switching the lock off for my husband to view. My living room is full-on daylight all day (cathedral ceiling, large trap windows) and this screen is amazing unlike our previous old tv. No longer is the screen hard to view because of direct sun. No more shutting blinds to see the screen. And forget the math formulas on getting a large screen if watching it from 12' away. We can easily watch & read what's onscreen from about 20' away. No problem with angles either. My complaint would be the time delay when changing channels. Instead of just popping up its got a couple secnds delay before the screen & sound come on. No issue with burn-in.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Matthew T. Singleton
Reviews.Content: I searched and reviewed for 3 months before I purchased the LG and absolutely love it.  I was surprised that the LG looked the best, especially when compared to the name brands like Samsung and Sony.  I have Vista Media Center hooked to TV, and the picture is crystal clear.  No regrets!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality - surround sound is a MUST!
Reviews.Author: CP3
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for 2 years now and have been extremely happy with the picture quality however the volume does not get loud enough. If you're purchasing this TV make sure to budget for speakers..Otherwise is a great price for the quality!

Reviews.Title: Good product.
Reviews.Author: Mary K. Hall "Mary"
Reviews.Content: We've had this tv for almost two years now and we like it.  The sound isn't great but that's to be expected from flat screens.  They just don't have good speakers usually. But it's easy enough to connect better speakers to the system. The picture's good and it's a good size.

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Randal Thompson "Toolman"
Reviews.Content: This is great bedroom TV. I have had this TV for over a year and I have not had any trouble with it. The setup was very easy. The remote is great. I have a DVD player and a WDTV connected to it and they both work great with this TV. You won't go wrong with this....

Reviews.Title: LG TV - as expected
Reviews.Author: David C. Williams
Reviews.Content: Great price and good Amazon service.  LG TV arrived and performed as expected.  This was a gift given to the wife's parents and they seem mroe than happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great performance for the money
Reviews.Author: Ron from MD
Reviews.Content: After comparing LCD TVs at several stores and reading internet reviews on many LCD manufactures within the same price range, screen size, and specs, I decided on the LG 37LG30 and ordered for the first time through Amazon.com.  I was not disappointed.  The TV was delivered within the estimated time frame undamaged.  The LCD has a great picture, sound, and looks fantastic mounted on our bedroom wall.  Because LCD's picture, sound, and cabinet looks are in the eyes of the buyer, take some time to view a variety of LCDs before buying.  But for certain, put the LG 37LG30 on your list for consideration.

Reviews.Title: LG37LG30 LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Mr. John Johnson "David Beckham"
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality, good picture, contrast and colour.Sharp images and easy to use remote control. Set up simple1st time purchase of an LG product....high quality and good professional classy finish.

Reviews.Title: Great product, 720p is adequate
Reviews.Author: Jopues
Reviews.Content: Nice sharp bright good looking well performing lots of connections.  Sounds a bit underpowered but then no other flat tv's better sounding.  Connected a soundmatters mainstageHD to deliver quality sound and now the combination's well worth.  No complaints albeit 37' might not suit bigger rooms, so choose size wisely.  720p's good only for this size, not bigger.  dual voltage's a plus.

Reviews.Title: lg tv
Reviews.Author: H. Verma "hv"
Reviews.Content: i think it a great tv ,clear picture, not too heavy,came in well packed. great service

Reviews.Title: Terrific TV
Reviews.Author: ShowMeGirl "ShowMeGirl"
Reviews.Content: Compared TVs everywhere (online & IRL) and couldn't find a better deal.  We couldn't tell any difference in picture quality between this and the higher priced Sony.  Decided the extra $100+ must be for the name, which was not important to us.Picture and sound are great out of the box with our regular Dishnetwork.  We haven't even bothered to upgrade to HD yet.Somebody mentioned the stand was difficult to attach, but I found that when I switched to a longer screwdriver, it went right together.  I am "mechanically challenged" and don't usually set up electronics or put together furniture, but my husband was out of town!

Reviews.Title: LG TV
Reviews.Author: Al Jones
Reviews.Content: This is our first HD TV and it is fantastic. I still look at the other TV's at places like Sam's Club, but anything close in quality is hundreds of dollars more. The picture is stunning. The sound quality is great, but the volume doesn't go very high. I'm going to have to go with a Surround System soon any way. I got a "Y" cable at Tiger Direct and hooked up the TV to my computer, and now I can have the biggest monitor in the neighborhood whenever I want. We still use a roof top antenna and get 65 crystal clear channels in suburban Chicago.

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: Joaquin Yip Salas
Reviews.Content: This is my first LCD so no prior experience. Works perfectly fine, easy to use. The base does not fit 100% to the LCD so there is a very slight movement to the front, however it can be fixed o fit.

Reviews.Title: a/v sync issues & no support
Reviews.Author: P. C. Miles "pcm"
Reviews.Content: I have had many LG products and been satisfied & that is what made my decision to purchase this model.  My unit has audio sync problems that are most prominent if you are utilizing the component inputs or the coaxial cable.  The sound is ahead of the picture.  I attempted to call LG & waited on hold for as long as I could on a few separate occasions. Their automated service even offers to call you back rather than wait on hold but guess what?  You never get that call back.  I finally attempted to use their online chat help and that person told me that unless you were using the HDMI cables you couldn't expect the audio to sync correctly.  So  I can play my PS3 with good audio but not use my cable service, Wii, or dvd player.  She couldn't explain why they even put component inputs on the TV if it would not work.  If you google "37lg30 a/v sync problems" you will find that this is a common issue with LG.  I purchased the unit at Best Buy and they are stepping up to the plate and sending somebody out to look at it( they don't agree with the logic of the LG support person).  I will never buy another LG product after this experience.
